body.p: To Thomas E. Bramlette Esqr Governor of Ky.

Your petitioner Alfred Brown respectfully State that on the 9th day of October 1865 he was arrested and tried before the county Judge of Russell County and by a jury fined the sum of $11:91 cents for a breach of the peace The facts of the case are substantially as follows -- he (your petitioner) is a member of Capt Woods Company of State guards and was detailed as a guard at the jail of Russell county and was on duty as a gard at the time when a young man named Davidson (a citizen) Came up to his post and attempted to take his gun away from him and in the tusle for the gun he struck him (Davidson) with the gun --
The premises Considered your petitioner respectfuly asks the remission of said fine and as in duty bound he will every pray &c
Sworn to and subscribed by Alfred Brown before me this 10th day of October 1865
We the undersigned Citizens of Russell county Ky. join in the prayer of the above petition of Alfred Brown and respectfully ask that the fine be remitted this 10th Oct 1865

H O Bolin
Lieut W, H, Walker
A, C, Wells
N. G Wells
Theo Jones
J H McBalld
Benjamin Ballenger
B, H, Walker
George Bryan
Green Moore
Wm G. Welson
Wm Lucas
Andrew Webb
A P Simpson
John D Bearnard

Russell County Ct
vs
Alfred Brown
$11.91
Remitted 13 Oct 1865
